recipes.title: Grilled Steak
instructions: Preheat the grill to high heat.
Rub the steaks with minced garlic and olive oil.
Season both sides of the steaks with salt and pepper.
Grill the steaks for 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they reach your desired level of doneness.
Remove the steaks from the grill and let them rest for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.title: Chicken Alfredo
ingredients: 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breasts, sliced
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain.
In a large skillet, cook chicken until no longer pink; remove and keep warm.
In the same skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook until fragrant.
Stir in cream and Parmesan cheese; cook until sauce thickens.
Add chicken and pasta to skillet; toss to coat with sauce.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.title: Beef Tacos
ingredients: Sour cream and salsa, for serving
instructions: In a large skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.
Add taco seasoning and water; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Heat taco shells according to package directions.
Fill shells with beef mixture, lettuce, tomato, and cheese.
Serve with sour cream and salsa, if desired.

recipes.title: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain.
In a large skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.
Add onion and garlic; cook until onion is tender.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve sauce over spaghetti.

recipes.title: Lemon Garlic Shrimp
ingredients: 1 lb raw shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, mix together shrimp, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Spread the shrimp mixture out in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until shrimp are cooked through.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Chicken Parmesan
ingredients: 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breasts, pounded thin
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cook spaghetti according to package directions, then drain and set aside.
Dredge chicken breasts in beaten eggs, then coat in breadcrumbs.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add a thin layer of oil.
Add chicken to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
In a 9x13 inch baking dish, spread a layer of tomato sauce on the bottom.
Arrange cooked chicken on top of the sauce, then pour remaining sauce over the chicken.
Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce, then bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve over cooked spaghetti and garnish with chopped basil.

recipes.title: Baked Salmon
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Line a baking sheet with foil and lightly grease with nonstick cooking spray.
In a small bowl, mix together garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Brush the garlic oil mixture over the salmon fillets, then top each fillet with a slice of lemon.
Bake in preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions, and reserve 1 cup of pasta water.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Parmesan cheese, and salt and pepper.
In a skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the pan and set it aside. Reserve 2 tablespoons of bacon fat in the skillet.
Add the cooked spaghetti and reserved pasta water to the skillet with the bacon fat. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the spaghetti is coated in the bacon fat.

Remove the skillet from the heat, and pour in the egg mixture. Stir the spaghetti vigorously until the eggs are cooked and the sauce is creamy. If the sauce is too thick, add a little more reserved pasta water.
Add the chopped bacon and parsley to the spaghetti and stir to combine. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Beef Stroganoff
instructions: Cook the egg noodles according to package instructions and set aside.
In a skillet, heat butter over medium heat. Add beef and cook until browned. Remove beef from skillet and set aside.
Add onions and mushrooms to the skillet and cook until onions are translucent.
Sprinkle flour over the onions and mushrooms, and stir to combine.
Gradually stir in the beef broth until mixture is smooth. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat and let it simmer for 5 minutes.
Stir in the sour cream, and then add the cooked beef strips. Heat the mixture until it's hot but not boiling.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the beef stroganoff over the cooked egg noodles.

recipes.title: Tomato Basil Soup
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onions and garlic and sauté until onions are translucent.
Add chopped tomatoes, vegetable broth, and chopped basil to the pot.
Bring mixture to a boil and then reduce heat to let it simmer for 15-20 minutes until the tomatoes are tender.
Remove the pot from heat and use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth. Alternatively, transfer the soup to a blender and blend until smooth, then return it to the pot.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with crusty bread or croutons.

recipes.title: Pesto Pasta
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions and set aside.
In a food processor, pulse together the basil, garlic, Parmesan cheese, and pine nuts until finely chopped.
Slowly pour in the olive oil while pulsing the mixture, until a smooth and creamy pesto sauce forms.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Toss the cooked pasta with the pesto sauce until it's well coated.
Serve hot with extra Parmesan cheese and pine nuts on top.

recipes.title: Garlic Butter Steak
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Heat a skillet over high heat.
Season the steaks with salt and pepper on both sides.
Add the steaks to the hot skillet and sear for 2-3 minutes on each side.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 6-8 minutes for medium-rare.
Remove the skillet from the oven and add minced garlic and butter.
Stir until the butter is melted and garlic is fragrant.
Baste the steaks with the garlic butter sauce for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Baked Salmon
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Line a baking sheet with foil.
In a small bowl, mix together honey, soy sauce, olive oil, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Place the salmon fillets on the prepared baking sheet.
Brush the honey mixture over the salmon fillets.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Beef Stroganoff
instructions: Cook egg noodles according to package directions; drain.
In a large skillet, cook beef over medium-high heat until browned; remove and keep warm.
In the same skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add onion, mushrooms, and garlic; cook until tender.
Stir in flour and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Gradually add beef broth, stirring constantly, until the sauce is thickened.
Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in sour cream.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the beef stroganoff over the cooked egg noodles.

recipes.title: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
instructions: In a medium saucepan, heat broth over medium-low heat.
In a large skillet or Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add mushrooms and cook until browned and tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Add arborio rice and stir until coated with oil and lightly toasted, about 2-3 minutes.
Add white wine and stir until mostly absorbed, about 2-3 minutes.
Add 1 cup of hot broth to the skillet and stir until mostly absorbed.
Repeat with remaining broth, adding 1 cup at a time and stirring until mostly absorbed each time.
Stir in Parmesan cheese and butter until melted and creamy.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Grilled Salmon
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, honey, Dijon mustard, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Brush the salmon fillets with the honey mustard mixture.
Place the salmon fillets on the grill, skin side down.
Grill for 5-7 minutes on each side, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients: 1 medium butternut squash, peeled and seeded
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).

Cut the butternut squash into cubes and toss with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and a pinch of salt and pepper. Spread the cubes out in a single layer on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until tender and caramelized.
In a large pot, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook for 3-4 minutes or until softened.

Add the roasted butternut squash to the pot, along with the chicken or vegetable broth, ground cinnamon, and ground nutmeg. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Remove the pot from the heat and use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth. Alternatively, you can carefully transfer the soup to a blender and blend in batches.
Return the soup to the pot and stir in the heavy cream. Reheat the soup over low heat if necessary, then season with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the soup hot, garnished with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of ground cinnamon, if desired.

recipes.title: Classic Lasagna
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse in cold water.
In a large skillet, cook ground beef, sausage, onion, and garlic over medium heat until meat is no longer pink.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, sugar, basil, fennel seeds, salt, and pepper.
Simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
In a 9x13 inch baking dish, layer 1/3 of the noodles, 1/3 of the meat sauce, 1/3 of the mozzarella, and 1/3 of the ricotta.
Repeat layers twice.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake, uncovered, for 25-30 minutes or until heated through.
Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
ingredients: 1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, red bell pepper, red onion, grape tomatoes, feta cheese, parsley, and mint.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld.

recipes.title: Shrimp Fajitas
ingredients: 1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
Optional toppings: sour cream, guacamole, salsa, cilantro, lime wedges
instructions: In a large bowl, toss the shrimp, bell peppers, onion, garlic, olive oil, chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat.
Add the shrimp mixture and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until shrimp are pink and vegetables are tender.
Warm the tortillas in the microwave or on a griddle.
Serve the shrimp and vegetable mixture with warm tortillas and desired toppings.

recipes.title: Caprese Salad
instructions: Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a platter, alternating them.
Sprinkle the chopped basil over the top.
In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Spicy Shrimp Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 pound raw shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, and cornstarch.
Add shrimp and toss to coat.
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add bell peppers and onion and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, or until just tender.
Add garlic, ginger, and red pepper flakes and stir-fry for 1 minute, or until fragrant.
Add shrimp and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until pink and cooked through.
In a small bowl, whisk together chicken broth, hoisin sauce, oyster sauce, soy sauce, and sugar.
Add sauce to the wok and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, or until sauce thickens.
Stir in green onions.
Serve over cooked rice.

recipes.title: Thai Green Curry
ingredients: Cooked rice or noodles, for serving
instructions: Heat the coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the onion, garlic, and ginger and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until softened.
Stir in the green curry paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add the coconut milk, vegetable broth, soy sauce, brown sugar, and lime juice and stir to combine.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and add the bell peppers, zucchini, and snap peas.
Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the sauce has thickened slightly.
Stir in the cilantro.
Serve the curry over rice or noodles.
